Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First, I need to calculate the total resolution time for each case. Resolution time is from when the ticket was received until it was closed. Let me go through each row:

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 101: Received at 8:00 AM on March 1st, closed at 10:15 AM same day. That's about 2 hours and 15 minutes.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 102: Received at 8:05 AM on March 1st, closed at 9:15 AM on March 2nd. That spans almost a full day (about 25 hours).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 103: From 8:10 AM to 9:30 AM same day. About 1 hour and 20 minutes.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 104: Received at 8:20 AM March 1st, closed at 8:30 AM March 2nd. Almost exactly 24 hours.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 105: From 8:25 AM March 1st to 9:30 AM March 3rd. Over two days and about 47 hours.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: So cases 102, 104, and especially 105 have significantly longer resolution times compared to the others.

Name: Pattern Recognition - NE
Text: Case 102 was escalated to Level-2 on March 1st at 11:30 AM but didn't start investigating until 2 PM next day. That's a big gap where nothing happened for almost 9 hours. Then resolving and closing on the second day.

Name: Pattern Recognition - NE
Text: Case 104 also had an escalation, which took a while to resolve, spanning two days with no work done during the first night. The same as 102 but even more time from investigation to resolution (from March 1st at 3 PM to March 2nd at 8 AM).

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Case 105 shows multiple escalations and delays: escalated on March 1st at 9:10 AM, then next activity was investigating two days later. Even after escalation, there's a long gap before resolution happens.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text:
Common factors seem to be:
- Escalations leading to longer waiting times.
- Gaps between activities (especially after escalations).
- Lack of immediate follow-up on escalated tickets.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Recommendations could include setting time limits for escalations and ensuring that Level-2 agents are more promptly available. Also, maybe automating the escalation process so it's handled faster. And having a system to track tickets that have been idle for too long.
